page.title: 04TOURISTS IN SALISBURY
page.content: Questions to tourists show that they:- 1.Visit the Museums in the Close. 2.Walk the town path to the Old Mill to see the view of the Cathedral which Constable made famous in his painting. 3.Visit Mompesson House owned by the National Trust and other Local Historic Houses. 4.Visit Stonehenge or Old Sarum. 5.Climb the Cathedral Tower. This causes many differing reactions and comments- "It was great, every bit worth the climb up all those old winding steps" -American Tourist. "A breathtaking experience, the view was magnificent" -Schoolgirl. "Horrible! there's that queasy moment you climb the last bit of ladder and squeeze over onto the parapet. That's a bad moment!"-Canon of the Cathedral. "I don't mind helicopters but I'm not keen on this !"- Prince of Wales.
